com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.implementations

Class SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.implementations.SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions
  • Enclosing class:
    SequenceExtractionUtilities

    public static class SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions
extends Object
    Represents options controlling how sequence extraction works in SequenceExtractionUtilities.extractIntervals(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.sequence.SequenceDocument, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.implementations.SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions).

      Constructs some new extraction options identical to the given ones.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions(SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions extractionOptionsToCopy)
        Constructs some new extraction options identical to the given ones.
        Parameters:
        extractionOptionsToCopy - the extraction options to copy
        Since:
        API 4.14 (Geneious 5.1)

      • SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions(int extractFrom,
                                             int extractTo)
        Construct the extraction options with a single interval from extractFrom to extractTo inclusive. If extractTo<extractFrom then the interval is extracted in the reverse direction.
        Parameters:
        extractFrom - the starting residue to extract in the range 1 to the sequence length.
        extractTo - the last residue (inclusive) to extract in the range 1 to the sequence length.

      • SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions(List<SequenceAnnotationInterval> intervals)
        Construct the extraction options from a list of intervals.
        Parameters:
        intervals - the intervals to extract. If multiple intervals are specified then the extracted intervals are concatenated together to form the returned sequence.

      • SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions(SequenceAnnotationInterval... intervals)
        Construct the extraction options from a list of intervals.
        Parameters:
        intervals - the intervals to extract. If multiple intervals are specified then the extracted intervals are concatenated together to form the returned sequence.

      • SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions(Interval... intervals)
        Construct the extraction options from a list of intervals.
        Parameters:
        intervals - the intervals to extract. If multiple intervals are specified then the extracted intervals are concatenated together to form the returned sequence.

    • Method Detail

      • setOverrideName

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions setOverrideName(String overrideName)
        Sets the name of the extracted sequence. If this is not set, a name is generated based on the options and the sequence being extracted from. If reusing these options for multiple calls to extract, this method can be called before each call to extract.
        Parameters:
        overrideName - the name to use for the extracted sequence or null to generated a name based on the options and the sequence being extracted from.
        Returns:
        this for convenience. e.g. SequenceExtractionUtilities.extract(new ExtractionOptions(...).setOverrideName(...))

      • setIntervals

        public void setIntervals(List<SequenceAnnotationInterval> intervals)
        Set the intervals to extract. If reusing these options for multiple calls to extract, this method should be called before each call to extract.
        Parameters:
        intervals - the intervals to extract. If multiple intervals are specified then the extracted intervals are concatenated together to form the returned sequence.
        Since:
        API 4.40 (Geneious 5.4.0)

      • setRemoveGaps

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions setRemoveGaps(boolean removeGaps)
        Set whether or not gaps should be removed during extraction. The default behavior is to remove gaps.
        Parameters:
        removeGaps - true to remove any gaps, false to maintain any gaps in the extracted sequence
        Returns:
        this for convenience. e.g. SequenceExtractionUtilities.extract(new ExtractionOptions(...).setRemoveGaps(...))

      • setPotentialAnnotationsToExtract

        public void setPotentialAnnotationsToExtract(Set<SequenceAnnotation> potentialAnnotationsToExtract)
        Tells the extract code which annotations are allowed to end up on the extracted sequence. If this method isn't called then all annotations are allowed to be extracted.
        Parameters:
        potentialAnnotationsToExtract - Potential annotations to extract, or null to allow all annotations to be extracted if they match. The annotations must be a subset of those on the source sequence.

      • setProgressListener

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions setProgressListener(ProgressListener progressListener)
        Sets a progress listener to report progress to during extraction and to allow a slow extraction call to be canceled. When a progress listener requests that an extraction be canceled, the extraction method will return null
        Parameters:
        progressListener - the progress listener
        Returns:
        this for convenience. e.g. SequenceExtractionUtilities.extract(new ExtractionOptions(...).setProgressListener(...))
        Since:
        API 4.701 (Geneious 7.0.1)

      • setAllowReverseComplement

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions setAllowReverseComplement(boolean allowReverseComplement)
        Set whether or not intervals in the reverse direction should be reverse complemented. The default behavior is to allow reverse complementing.
        Parameters:
        allowReverseComplement - true to allow intervals in the reverse direction to be reverse complemented.
        Returns:
        this for convenience. e.g. SequenceExtractionUtilities.extract(new ExtractionOptions(...).setAllowReverseComplement(...))

      • setResiduesOnly

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions setResiduesOnly(boolean residuesOnly)
        Set whether or not to ignore any annotations on the source sequence, and extract the residues only. Generally this is only used for performance reasons to avoid unnecessarily handling annotations. The default behavior is to extract annotations from the source sequence.
        Parameters:
        residuesOnly - true to ignore any annotations on the source sequence.
        Returns:
        this for convenience. e.g. SequenceExtractionUtilities.extract(new ExtractionOptions(...).setResiduesOnly(...))

      • setTranslation

        @Deprecated
public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions setTranslation(GeneticCode geneticCode,
                                                                      int translationFrame)
        Deprecated. use setTranslation(GeneticCode geneticCode, int translationFrame, boolean removeFinalStopCodon, boolean translateFirstCodonUsingFirstCodonTable) instead.
        Sets the extraction to translate while extracting. The default behavior is to not translate.
        Parameters:
        geneticCode - the genetic code to use during translation or null to not translate.
        translationFrame - the translation frame to use if translating relative to the interval being extracted. Either 0, 1, or 2. Should be 0 if geneticCode==null. To translate in reverse, specify an interval in the reverse direction in the extraction options constructor.
        Returns:
        this for convenience. e.g. SequenceExtractionUtilities.extract(new ExtractionOptions(...).setTranslation(...))

      • setTranslation

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions setTranslation(GeneticCode geneticCode,
                                                           int translationFrame,
                                                           boolean translateFirstCodonUsingFirstCodonTable,
                                                           boolean removeFinalStopCodon)
        Sets the extraction to translate while extracting. The default behavior is to not translate.
        Parameters:
        geneticCode - the genetic code to use during translation or null to not translate.
        translationFrame - the translation frame to use if translating relative to the interval being extracted. Either 0, 1, or 2. Should be 0 if geneticCode==null. To translate in reverse, specify an interval in the reverse direction in the extraction options constructor.
        translateFirstCodonUsingFirstCodonTable - each genetic code specifies a set of codons which get translated as M if they are the first codon even though they normally wouldn't translate as an M when occurring elsewhere a coding region. If this parameter is true the first codon will be translated using this alternative translation table for the genetic code.
        removeFinalStopCodon - whether to remove the stop codon at the end of the sequence, if any
        Returns:
        this for convenience. e.g. SequenceExtractionUtilities.extract(new ExtractionOptions(...).setTranslation(...))
        Since:
        API 4.41 (Geneious 5.4.1)

      • setTruncateAnnotationsIfNecessary

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions setTruncateAnnotationsIfNecessary(boolean truncateAnnotationsIfNecessary)
        Sets whether or not to truncate annotations extending outside the extracted region so that they lie entirely within the extracted region. The default behaviour is to not truncate. An annotation interval can be queried if is is truncated using SequenceAnnotationInterval.isTruncatedAtMaximumIndex() and SequenceAnnotationInterval.isTruncatedAtMinimumIndex().
        Parameters:
        truncateAnnotationsIfNecessary - true to truncate annotations extending outside the extracted region.
        Returns:
        this for convenience. e.g. SequenceExtractionUtilities.extract(new ExtractionOptions(...).setTruncateAnnotationsIfNecessary(...))

      • setMustGenerateDefaultSequenceDocument

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions setMustGenerateDefaultSequenceDocument(boolean mustGenerateDefaultSequenceDocument)
        Sets whether or not the result returned from the extraction must be a DefaultSequenceDocument. Even if this is false, the returned document may be any SequenceDocument implementation decided on by the extraction implementation.
        Parameters:
        mustGenerateDefaultSequenceDocument - true to force the result returned from the extraction to be a DefaultSequenceDocument
        Returns:
        this for convenience
        Since:
        API 4.14 (Geneious 5.1)

      • setMustGenerateLinearSequence

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions setMustGenerateLinearSequence(boolean mustGenerateLinearSequence)
        Sets whether or not the result returned from the extraction must be a linear sequence, even if extracting the entire length of a circular sequence.
        Parameters:
        mustGenerateLinearSequence - true to force the result returned from the extraction to be a linear sequence.
        Returns:
        this for convenience
        Since:
        API 4.700 (Geneious 7.0.0)

      • setIncludeIntersectingAnnotations

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions setIncludeIntersectingAnnotations(boolean includeIntersectingAnnotations)
        Sets whether or not the result returned from the extraction should include annotations which intersect the extracted region rather than being contained within it entirely. The default behaviour of this method is to include intersecting annotations (setIncludeIntersectingAnnotations(true))
        Parameters:
        includeIntersectingAnnotations - whether or not the result returned from the extraction should include annotations which intersect the extracted region.
        Returns:
        this for convenience
        Since:
        API 4.700 (Geneious 7.0.0)

      • setCreateExtractionAnnotations

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions setCreateExtractionAnnotations(boolean shouldCreate)
        Decides whether or not extraction should create extraction annotations.
        Parameters:
        shouldCreate - whether or not to create extraction annotations
        Returns:
        this for convenience
        Since:
        API 4.900 (Geneious 9.0.0)

      • setKeepPrimersSpanningOverhang

        public SequenceExtractionUtilities.ExtractionOptions setKeepPrimersSpanningOverhang(boolean keepPrimersSpanningOverhang)
        Decides whether or not extraction should keep primer and restriction site annotations if the extraction truncates a primer or restriction site because it extends to a flanking overhang that is removed as preparation for a ligation.
        Parameters:
        keepPrimersSpanningOverhang - whether or not to keep the primer and restriction site annotations instead of removing them. Will keep only full annotations, discards them anyway if the annotation extends into a part that is neither covered by the extraction interval nor an overhang.
        Returns:
        this for convenience
        Since:
        API 4.900 (Geneious 9.0.0)
